title: Enable direct download of OO RAS and OO Workflow Designer from the Service Management UI
content:
The On-Premises Bridge download center provides download links to endpoint resources. In the Operations Orchestration (OO) section, there's a link to the software product website, from which you can search for and then download OO installation files.

If your suite is using the OO Containerized, which has the OO RAS and OO Workflow Designer installation and upgrade files embedded in it, you have the option to replace the product website link with direct download links to these embedded installation and upgrade files. Clicking each direct download link will trigger an automatic download of the corresponding installation or upgrade file.

You need to use a script available from the ITOM Marketplace to replace the download link. Additionally, this script allows you to replace the download link for all tenants in one go or only for one tenant at one time.  

Prerequisites

  • Both Service Management and OO Containerized are running. Integration setup between Service Management and OO Containerized isn't a prerequisite.
  • You know the password of the bo-integration@dummy.com user. Its initial password is specified during the suite installation.
    If you don't know this password, refer to this topic for how to change or retrieve the password for the system-level integration user.

Replace the original OO download link

  1. Download the SMA Operation Toolkit from the ITOM Marketplace. Find the enable_download.py script in the enable_download folder.
  2. Copy the script to a temporary directory on a control plane node or the bastion node of your cluster.
  3. Run the script: 
    python3 enable_download.py <Host> <TenantID> bo-integration@dummy.com <Password> https://<OO_Host>:<Port>/oo/downloader OO_DOWNLOAD_SERVICE
    Where:
    • <Service_Management_Host> is the external access host name of the Service Management system.
    • <TenantID> is the ID of the target tenant (for example, 604006505). If you omit this parameter, the script will run for all tenants in the Service Management system.
    • <Password> is the password of the bo-integration@dummy.com user. 
    • <OO_Host> and<Port> are the external access host name and port of OO Containerized, which you can find from its login URL.

    For example:

    python3 enable_download.py mysmax.mycompany.net 566500008 bo-integration@dummy.com Admin_6486 https://myoo.mycompany.net:9443/oo/downloader OO_DOWNLOAD_SERVICE
  4. Wait until the terminal returns the following message:  
    Updated setting to :https://<OO_Host>:<Port>/oo/downloader.
  5. Verify that the new download links are available:
    1. Log in to the agent interface as the tenant admin.
    2. Navigate to Administration > Utilities > Integration, click Agents on the top of the screen and then select Endpoints from the list.
    3. Verify that the Operations Orchestration section now looks like below:
    4. On the right pane, click the download links and verify that the browser automatically downloads the files.
      • OO RAS
        • ras-installer-win-<version>.zip
        • ras-installer-linux-<version>.zip
        • ras-upgrader-<version>.zip
      • OO Wokflow Designer
        • designer-installer-linux-<version>.zip
        • designer-upgrader-<version>.zip
        • designer-installer-win-<version>.zip

How to restore the original download link

If you want to restore the original OO download link, run the following command on a control plane mode or the bastion node: 

python3 enable_download.py <Service_Management Host> <TenantID> bo-integration@dummy.com <password> '' OO_DOWNLOAD_SERVICE

This command and the earlier command are basically the same, except that this command includes only a pair of single quotation marks in place of the OO downloader URL. 

For example:

python3 enable_download.py mysmax.mycompany.net 566500008 bo-integration@dummy.com Admin_6486 '' OO_DOWNLOAD_SERVICE
